comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: I'm going to completely usurp this PR and ask everyone: do you _want_ the Linux packages to install to `/usr/local`? Obviously, once distributions' repositories start packaging PowerShell, they'll install to `/usr`. I used `/opt` simply to be consistent with other Microsoft products being distributed as third party packages, and I couldn't ask the community at the time. Now I'm asking 😄

comments.author: jhasse
comments.body:
> do you want the Linux packages to install to /usr/local?

No. I expect everything in `/usr/local` not to be handled by the package manager but by myself (e. g. when installing from source).

comments.author: plinnell
comments.body:
> I  used /opt simply to be consistent with other Microsoft products being distributed as third party packages, and I couldn't ask the community at the time. Now I'm asking :smile:

For Linux, this is very much an acceptable solution.  /usr/local should never be touched by packaging

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Sounds like using `/opt` for Linux was the right decision, thanks for your input!
